rules.description: The website provides a way for users to find out about new content and services.
Information about copyrights and reuse rights is available from every page.
Each page’s source code contains metadata that describes the content.
Dates are presented in an explicit format.
The first occurrence of an abbreviation or an acronym in the body of any page gives access to an explanation of its meaning.
The publication date of the contents is indicated when needed.
A lexicon or a glossary adapted to the target audience explains the industry-specific or technical vocabulary used.
Advertisements and sponsored content are identified as such.
The conditions for moderation of public spaces are indicated.
Content and files intended for public spaces can be checked before upload.
Public spaces offer at least one way to report abuse.
Each graph is accompanied by its numerical data.
The search result page indicates the number of results, the number of pages of results, and the number of results per page.
The privacy and confidentiality policy is available from any page.
The process of accessing and modifying personal data is described.
Account creation is possible without the need to use a third-party identification system.
Account creation is subject to a confirmation process.
The website offers a mechanism to prevent account or identity theft.
Accounts and subscriptions opened online can be closed online by the same method.
If the website offers a personal or subscriber space, it is possible to download personal content.
Connection to all the services offered is possible with the same identifiers.
It is possible to log out from private areas.
The website accepts email aliases containing the + sign.
The headers sent by the server specify the communication policy of the referrers.
External links that open in a new window don't share contextual information.
Exchanges of sensitive data are securely transmitted and reported as such.
Sensitive data is not transmitted unencrypted through URLs.
The purpose of using cookies, as well as the limitations inherent in refusing them, are explained.
A product or service can be purchased without creating an account.
The details of each item can be viewed from the shopping cart.
No additional products or services are added to the shopping cart without being user triggered.
Registration for ancillary services is not enabled by default.
Product availability is indicated before final validation of the order.
The estimated delivery time is indicated before the final validation of the order.
The estimated delivery costs are indicated before the final validation of the order.
The method for retrieving a dematerialised or digital product is specified before placing the order.
Users can still modify each item’s quantity, and add or delete one or more items, before the final validation of the order.
The nature and quantifiable characteristics of products and services are indicated.
The period of validity and conditions of special offers and promotions are indicated.
The detailed sub-total is indicated before final validation of the order.
The conditions of financing are indicated.
The operating conditions of the after-sales service are indicated.
Debit and payment conditions are indicated before final order placement.
Warranty conditions are indicated.
The terms of sale or use are available from all pages.
The information relating to the delivery zones of the products or the realization of the services are indicated.
The means of payment accepted, and the corresponding procedures are indicated.
The identity of third parties involved in transactions is specified.
The recourse in cases of dispute are indicated in the general terms and conditions of sale or of use.
The address and the terms and conditions for returns are indicated before the final validation of the return order.
The cost of the return is indicated before the final validation of the return order.
The mode of filing and the procedure for handling complaints are indicated.
The conditions for reimbursement are indicated.
The hardware and software necessary for the operation of the service are indicated before final validation of the order.
The displayed prices show the applied taxes and any additional charges, as well as tax-exclusive prices.
Different shipping and billing addresses can be specified.
The website accepts at least two methods of payment.
Personal banking information is only stored after the explicit consent of the user.
The personal banking information stored by the website can be modified or deleted at any time.
The transaction’s reference number is displayed to the customer, once the order has been placed.
The invoices issued are also available online
Each invoice is subject to a confirmation email.
Any mention of an affiliation with a professional association, or endorsement by a label or an award, features a link to the source.
Unavailable products are differentiated by visual and textual means.
An email providing the transaction’s reference number and the order details is sent after order placement.
Each complaint is issued with an acknowledgment of receipt.
Each form field has its own label associated with it in the source code.
Information supplementing a field’s label is associated with that field in the source code.
Each form field’s label indicates whether or not it is a required field.
Each form field’s label indicates the required data format, where applicable.
The user is warned whenever a field is case-sensitive.
The label of each form field indicates the maximum number of characters allowed, where applicable.
The creation of a password by the user is subject to a mechanism for the prevention of input errors.
The characters entered in a password field can be displayed in an un-encrypted text.
Each form label is visually associated to the field that it describes.
The contextual information relating to a form field has a close visual-proximity to it.
If any data entered in the form are rejected, the fields containing the rejected data are indicated for the user.
If any data entered in the form are rejected, the reason(s) why are indicated to the user.
If any data entered in the form are rejected, all the data entered can be modified by the user.
Custom error messages are expressed in the language of the form.
For forms divided over several pages, an overall summary is displayed before the final version is submitted.
The page displayed after the form’s submission allows the user to return to their navigation directly.
Form submission is followed by a message indicating whether or not the action was successful.
The user is alerted at the beginning of a complex process to the nature of the required data and documents.
Complex processes are accompanied by a list of their steps.
The current step in a complex process is indicated.
Each step in a complex process allows the user to go back to the previous step.
The user is warned when they will lose information if they go back using their browser’s history during a complex process.
Navigating through a complex process does not cause any previously-submitted data to be lost.
Copy-and-paste is possible in the form’s fields.
The items in a drop-down list are grouped together appropriately, where applicable.
The lists of form options are presented in an identifiable order.
Email, URL, telephone number, search, password, and date and time input fields are assigned an appropriate input type.
The homepage explains the nature of the content and services offered.
If the website is reserved or intended for a specific audience, that audience is mentioned, at least on the homepage.
The identity of the author, the company or the organization is indicated.
Each page provides a title that enables one to identify the website
Each page provides a title that enables one to identify its content
The source code of the pages contains a valid call to a favourite icon (“favicon”)
The complete address and telephone number of companies and organizations are available from all pages of the website.
The registration number issued to companies or organizations under the legal registration procedures in force in their country is indicated.
The website provides at least two means of contact.
Response times for information requests are indicated.
The operating hours and prices for the services made available to users are indicated.
Each request for information is followed by an acknowledgement receipt.
All emails provide at least one means of contact.
The website provides at least one means of contacting the person in charge of complaints.
The website provides at least one means of contacting the moderator of public spaces.
The identity of the person or department responsible for the content is indicated.
If the website claims to adhere to one or more standards or guidelines, a link is provided to each of them.
Each decorative image has an appropriate text alternative.
Each image link has an appropriate text alternative.
Each information-carrying image has an appropriate text alternative.
Thumbnails and previews are not larger images resized on the client side.
Included objects have an appropriate text alternative.
Each audio and video content is accompanied by a text transcription.
Videos have synchronized subtitles.
The length of video and audio content is indicated.
Videos are user-triggered.
Sounds are user-triggered.
Video content and animations, sounds and flashes can be paused.
The running of video or any animation does not block access to navigation or content.
The international dialling codes are available for all phone numbers.
The country is specified for all mailing addresses.
Each page’s source code indicates the content’s main language.
The main language of a link’s target page can be identified when it differs from the main language of the original page.
Each language change is identified.
Links to translated versions point directly to the current page’s translation.
Links to equivalent versions of a page or website are written in the target language.
The server respects the preferential order of languages specified by user agents.
Each link has a title in the source code.
Each link’s label describes either its function or the nature of the content of its target.
Links of the same nature have identical colors, shapes and behaviors on all pages.
Underlining is reserved for links.
Links are visually differentiated from the rest of the content.
The website applies a different style to visited and unvisited links.
Internal and external links are differentiated.
Internal links to restricted content are differentiated.
Links which cause external software to open have an explicit label.
Telephone numbers can be enabled using the appropriate protocol.
The user is notified when new windows are to be opened.
The format of the files available for download is indicated.
The size of the internal files available for downloading is indicated.
The language of downloadable files is mentioned when it differs from the original page.
Internal names for downloadable files make it possible to identify their content and origin.
The website does not prohibit or restrict incoming links.
All links internal to the website are valid.
If the website is not restricted to a specific public, its content can be accessed directly.
Navigating the website does not open any pop-up windows.
It is possible to return to the homepage from any page.
Each page displays information about its location in the website’s tree structure.
Active menu items are identifiable.
Navigation blocks of the same nature are in the same place on every page.
Navigation icons are provided with an explicit legend.
Mechanisms for closing windows are visually linked to their content.
Mechanisms for closing windows are immediately available.
Newly dimensioned windows and modal windows are equipped with an explicit close button.
Mechanisms for closing windows are shown in the same location on every page.
Each page contains quick-access links placed at the beginning of the source code.
Keyboard focus isn't removed or masked.
The website can be used and navigated in its entirety using only a keyboard.
Keyboard navigation is set up in a predictable order.
The website offers an internal search engine.
Each search results page can be reached via a web address.
It is possible to relaunch a search from its results page.
The site map is available from every page.
The time limits imposed on an action or access are indicated.
Subscribing to newsletters is subject to a confirmation process.
An unsubscribe link is provided in each newsletter.
Unsubscribing from within the newsletter does not require email confirmation.
It is possible to unsubscribe from newsletters from the website.
The latest edition of the newsletter is available online.
Newsletter archives are available online.
The newsletters’ frequency can be found before subscribing.
The graphic charter is consistent throughout the website.
Information is not conveyed by color alone.
Content is presented with sufficient contrast to its background.
The content and meaning of each page are not altered when styles are disabled.
Content is not only designated by its shape or its position on the screen.
Content that needs to be reproduced by screen readers is not hidden from them.
The size of the clickable elements is sufficient.
Texts that can be formatted via styles are not replaced by images.
Content generated via styles is provided with a suitable alternative.
Typographic symbols have an appropriate alternative.
A generic font family is listed as the last alternative in font family lists.
Styles do not justify the text.
Capitalization for decorative purposes is done using styles.
The website does not block the browser’s zoom functionalities.
The website offers one or more mechanisms for adapting to mobile devices.
The website offers styles dedicated to printing.
The content of each page can be printed without printing the navigation blocks.
All pages use the HTTPS protocol.
Security certificates are signed and currently valid
Pages using HTTPS have a strict transport header.
Pages using the HTTPS protocol do not offer HTTP resources.
Password operations can be carried out in their entirety online.
Passwords can be chosen and changed by the user
A mechanism raises the user's awareness regarding their password's level of security
The website provides a way to reinitialise a password.
The website doesn't communicate a password by email.
The headers sent by the server disable automatic detection of each resource’s MIME type.
The server indicates each resource’s MIME type.
Information relative to transaction security is indicated.
The server does not send the file listing of directories with no index page.
The server sends activation information for protection against cross-site scripting.
The server sends information that indicates which domains are allowed to embed its pages in frames
The website offers a security mechanism that limits the sources of its content.
The server doesn't communicate information on the software and languages used.
Integrity control of third party resources is present and valid.
The website offers at least two mechanisms to validate a secure operation.
The address of the website and of its subdomains works with and without a www prefix.
The website’s root contains instructions for web crawlers.
The website provides a sitemap file listing the content to be crawled.
The server does not force redirects from the desktop version to the mobile version or application.
The server sends a 404 HTTP error code for resources not found
The server sends a customised 404 Not found error page
The server sends a customised 403 “Forbidden” error page.
The main navigation menu is displayed on custom error pages.
The server transmits compressed contents to the clients which accept them.
The server sends information to enable the caching of contents
Headers sent by the server contain information pertaining to the character set used
Style sheets of the website are minified.
Scripts of the website are minified.
The date of publication or update of the contents is made available in a programmatic form.
Each page’s source code contains metadata which defines the character set used.
The character encoding is UTF-8.
Each page’s content is organized according to a hierarchical structure of headings and sub-headings.
Elements that are visually displayed as lists are tagged in an appropriate way in the source code.
Each HTML ID is only used once per page.
The website does not block the copying of content.
The website does not block access to the contextual menu.
The website does not force any redirects or auto-refreshes on the client side.
The text of internal PDF documents can be selected.
Internal PDF documents are given a structure based on titles.
Syndication feeds can be detected by user agents
Cells in data tables are linked to their headers
Captions for data tables are provided
Linearising tables used for layout does not impede the understanding of contents
Data tables are not replaced by images.
Data tables are not simulated through styled text
